snippet: Human Rights Watch said there was evidence that the extremist group used the munitions in July and August as it fought in northern Syria.
abstract: Human Rights Watch says Islamic State in Iraq and Syria has attacked enemies with cluster bombs, banned weapons that kill and maim indiscriminately, citing photographic evidence from Syria.
lead_paragraph: Human Rights Watch said there was evidence that the extremist group used the munitions in July and August as it fought in northern Syria.

headline.main: Militants Add Cluster Bombing to Tactics, Rights Group Says
headline.print_headline: Militants Add Cluster Bombing to Tactics, Rights Group Says
